fig.title: : Characterization of CATSPER2-deficient human sperm.
fig.label: Figure 1
fig.sd-panel: Representative Ca2+ signals in sperm from a patient with deafness-infertility syndrome lacking functional CatSper channels (CATSPER2-/-) (red) and a healthy donor (black), evoked by progesterone, PGE1, NH4Cl, or ionomycin. NH4Cl increases the intracellular pH. Bar graph: Amplitudes (n = 4; mean ± SD) of Ca2+ signals in CATSPER2-/- sperm

Representative monovalent CatSper currents in CATSPER2-/- sperm (blue, green, orange, purple, brown) and in sperm from a healthy donor (black) and corresponding current-voltage relationship (right). The membrane voltage was stepped from -100 mV to +100 mV in increments of 10 mV from a holding potential of -80 mV. Outward and inward current amplitudes (mean ± SD) at +100 mV and -100 mV, respectively, in CATSPER2-/- sperm (color code: panel B) and sperm from healthy donors (black).

Representative immunocytochemical staining of control sperm from healthy donors and CATSPER2-/- sperm form DIS patients using antibodies directed against CatSper 3 (D) or CatSper 4 (E); DNA was labelled with DAPI (blue). Scale bars represent 10 µm.

3D-STORM image in xy-projection of sperm from a healthy donor labelled with the anti-CatSper 3 antibody (left). Axial projection of the boxed region (right). Scale bars represent 5 µm in xy-projections and 200 nm in axial projections.

3D-STORM images in xy-projection of CATSPER2-/- sperm (left) labelled with the anti-CatSper 3 (upper panel) and anti-CatSper 4 (lower panel) antibody. Axial projection of the boxed regions (right). Scale bars represent 5 µm in xy-projections and 200 nm in axial projections.

fig.title: : Analysis of longitudinal rolling of human sperm.
fig.label: Figure 2
fig.sd-panel: Experimental setup for population analysis by dark-field microscopy.
Dark-field microscopy of a single sperm; shown are single frames obtained at t = 0, 48, 96, and 136 ms. Scale bar = 25 µm

Dark-field imaging of a sperm population; left: single frames at t = 185, 363, 540, and 718 ms. Sperm selected for analysis are highlighted (1-4). Right: Temporal change in the brightness (blinking) of sperm heads. The blue lines correspond to the time-points of the single frames. Scale bar = 25 µm.

Representative distribution of rotation frequencies of freely swimming non-capacitated (0 mM bicarbonate; black; n = 218) and capacitated sperm (25 mM bicarbonate; red; n = 232) determined by dark-field imaging.
Rolling frequency (mean ± SD) of non-capacitated (0 mM bicarbonate, n = 1,455) and capacitated sperm (25 mM bicarbonate, n = 1,097).
Rolling frequency (mean ± SD) of freely swimming sperm in 0 (n = 1,175), 0.2 (n = 832), and 1 % (w/v) (n = 599) methyl cellulose. .
Experimental setup for the laser-based optical tweezer.
Bright-field images of an optically trapped sperm cell, obtained at t = 0, 55, 155, and 185 ms. Scale bar represents 10 µm.

Representative time-course of the rotation frequency of trapped sperm (each sperm cell is represented by a different color). Error bars indicate the full width at half prominence of the frequency peaks determined by the fast Fourier analysis..
Distribution of rotation frequencies in trapped sperm (n = 32; mean frequency ± SD 6.0 ± 2.1 Hz).

Image series of a sperm cell trapped parallel to the optical axis; images were obtained at t = 0, 95, 165, and 205 ms. The red bar indicates the 360° rotation of the tip of the head. Scale bar represents 10 µm.

Representative distribution of rotation frequencies of freely swimming CatSper-deficient sperm incubated under non-capacitating (0 mM bicarbonate; black; n = 73) and capacitating conditions (25 mM bicarbonate; red; n = 272).
Rolling frequency (mean ± SD) of freely swimming CATSPER2-/- sperm incubated under non-capacitating (0 mM bicarbonate, n = 1009) and capacitating (25 mM bicarbonate, n = 946) conditions.
Rolling frequency (mean ± SD) of freely swimming CATSPER2-/- sperm in 0 (n = 457), 0.2 (n = 389), and 1 % (w/v) (n = 187) methyl cellulose.

Image series of a CATSPER2-/- sperm cell optically trapped perpendicular to the optical axis; images were obtained at t = 0, 75, 150, and 225 ms. Scale bar represents 10 µm. Image series of a CATSPER2-/- sperm cell optically trapped parallel to the optical axis; images were obtained at t = 0, 60, 195, and 320 ms. The red bar indicates the 360° rotation of the tip of the head. Scale bar represents 10 µm. Representative time courses of the rotation frequencies of optically trapped CATSPER2-/- sperm (each sperm is represented in a different color). Error bars indicate the full width at half prominence of the frequency peaks determined by the fast Fourier analysis.

fig.title: : The action of bicarbonate and Ca2+ on longitudinal rolling of human sperm.
fig.label: Figure 3
fig.sd-panel: Experimental setup to subject optically trapped sperm to different conditions in a three-channel microfluidic capillary.

Rotation frequency of a trapped sperm cell before and after dragging across the barrier stream. The green trace indicates the fluorescence of fluorescein included in the barrier stream. Error bars indicate the full width at half prominence of the frequency peaks determined by the fast Fourier analysis. Paired plot of rotation frequencies of individual sperm cells before and after dragging across the barrier stream.

Rotation frequency of a trapped sperm cell before and after dragging from the control stream containing 0 mM bicarbonate into the stimulus stream containing 25 mM bicarbonate. Error bars indicate the full width at half prominence of the frequency peaks determined by the fast Fourier analysis. Paired plot of rotation frequencies of individual sperm at 0 and 25 mM bicarbonate.

Rotation frequency of a trapped sperm cell in the presence and absence of extracellular Ca2+. Error bars indicate the full width at half prominence of the frequency peaks determined by the fast Fourier analysis. Paired plot of rotation frequencies in the presence and absence of extracellular Ca2+.
Fraction of motile sperm (mean ± SD) in a sperm population incubated in the presence (black) and absence (at t = 0) of extracellular Ca2+ (red) (n ≥ 5).
Distribution of rotation frequencies in populations of freely swimming sperm in the presence (black, n = 335) and absence (red, n = 224) of extracellular Ca2+ (red).

fig.title: : Rheotaxis of human sperm.
fig.label: Figure 4
fig.sd-panel: Trajectories of human sperm in the absence of a fluid flow. Sperm were tracked for 1.86 s. The starting point of each trajectory was centered to the origin of a coordinate system, represented by the intersection of the dotted lines in the center of the circle. Spider-web plot of the mean (± SD) angular frequencies (binning: 315°-45°, 45°-135°, 135°-225°, and 225°-315°; 1,301 sperm; 7 experiments) in the absence of a fluid flow. Representative trajectories of human sperm in the presence of a fluid flow. Spider-web plot of the mean (± SD) angular frequencies (1,083 sperm; 7 experiments) in the presence of a fluid flow. The red arrow indicates the flow direction. Representative trajectories of CATSPER2-/- sperm in the absence of a fluid flow. Spider-web plot of mean (± SD) angular frequencies of CATSPER2-/- sperm in the absence of a fluid flow (1,068 sperm; 6 experiments). Trajectories of CATSPER2-/- sperm in the presence of a fluid flow. Spider-web plot of the mean (± SD) angular frequencies of CATSPER2-/- sperm in the presence of a fluid flow (1,068 sperm; 7 experiments). The red arrow indicates the fluid flow direction. Representative trajectories of CATSPER2-/- sperm in Ca2+-free buffer in the absence of a fluid flow. Spider-web plot of the mean (± SD) angular frequencies (442 sperm; 4 experiments) of CATSPER2-/- sperm in Ca2+-free buffer in the absence of a fluid flow. Representative trajectories of CATSPER2-/- sperm in Ca2+-free buffer in the presence of a fluid flow. Spider-web plot of the mean (± SD) angular frequencies (620 sperm; 4 experiments) of CATSPER2-/- sperm in Ca2+-free buffer in the presence of a fluid flow. The red arrow indicates the flow direction.

fig.title: : Rolling behavior and rheotaxis of mouse sperm.
fig.label: Figure 5
fig.sd-panel: Left: Bright-field image series of a freely swimming wild-type sperm cell at t = 0, 151, and 303 ms. Scale bar represents 10 µm. Right: Rotation frequency (mean ± SD) of 24 freely swimming wild-type sperm. Left: Bright-field image series of a freely swimming Catsper1-/- sperm cell at t = 0, 151, and 294 ms. Scale bar represents 10 µm. Right: Rotation frequency (mean ± SD) of 24 freely swimming Catsper1-/- sperm.

Representative trajectories of wild-type sperm in the absence of a fluid flow. The starting point of each trajectory was centered to the origin of a coordinate system, represented by the intersection of the dotted lines in the center of the circle. Each color represents one trajectory. Spider-web plot of the mean (± SD) angular frequencies (binning: 315°-45°, 45°-135°, 135°-225°, and 225°-315°; 127 sperm; 3 experiments) in the absence of a fluid flow. Representative trajectories of wild-type sperm in the presence of a fluid flow. Spider-web plot of the mean (± SD) angular frequencies (175 sperm; 3 experiments) of wild-type sperm in the presence of a fluid flow. The red arrow indicates the flow direction. Representative trajectories of Catsper1-/- sperm in the absence of a fluid flow. The starting point of each trajectory was centered to the origin of a coordinate system, represented by the intersection of the dotted lines in the center of the circle. Trajectories are magnified by a factor of 2.05 with respect to the plots C and E to compensate for the reduced swimming speed of the Catsper1-/- sperm. Spider-web plot of the mean (± SD) angular frequencies of Catsper1-/- sperm (297 sperm; 4 experiments) in the absence of a fluid flow. Representative trajectories of Catsper1-/- sperm in the presence of a fluid flow; Trajectories are magnified by a factor of 2.05 with respect to the plots C and E to compensate for the reduced swimming speed of the Catsper1-/- sperm, two trajectories were truncated (indicated by two parallel lines). Spider-web plot of the mean (± SD) angular frequencies (261 sperm; 4 experiments) of Catsper1-/- sperm in the presence of a fluid flow. The red arrow indicates the flow direction.

fig.title: : Rheotaxis of human sperm in viscous media and in the presence of progesterone.
fig.label: Figure 6
fig.sd-panel: Spider-web plot of the mean (± SD) angular frequencies (binning: 315°-45°, 45°-135°, 135°-225°, and 225°-315°; 403 sperm; 3 experiments) of human sperm swimming in buffer fortified with 0.2 % (w/v) methyl cellulose in the presence of a fluid flow. Spider-web plot of the mean (± SD) angular frequencies (520 sperm; 3 experiments) of human CATSPER2-/- sperm swimming in buffer fortified with 0.2 % (w/v) methyl cellulose in the presence of a fluid flow. Spider-web plot of the mean (± SD) angular frequencies (binning: 315°-45°, 45°-135°, 135°-225°, and 225°-315°; 454 sperm; 3 experiments) of human sperm swimming in buffer fortified with 100 nM progesterone in the presence of a fluid flow. Spider-web plot of the mean (± SD) angular frequencies (372 sperm; 3 experiments) of human CATSPER2-/- sperm swimming in buffer fortified with 100 nM progesterone in the presence of a fluid flow.
